description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners capacity is strengthened for disaster prevention and management, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New ElementBuilding FOs' capacity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners capacity is strengthened for disaster prevention and management

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners capacities to prevent and manage disasters in 2021 was strengthened through trainings on emergency procedures, early preparedness and contingency planning, testing of business continuity plans, supply pre-positioning, as well as through active and consistent coordination, leadership and advocacy internally and externally at the federal, regional and subregional levels. This enabled the prompt delivery of services and supplies to affected populations throughout the numerous emergency responses conducted over the year.This was enhanced through mandatory humanitarian learning as undertaken by 92 per cent of staff. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022
